pageContext.claim: “People knew [the novel coronavirus] was airborne. This was nothing -- this was no big -- when I say it was airborne, everybody knew it was airborne. This was no big thing.”
pageContext.analysis: There was considerable debate about whether or not the virus was airborne. It was not until March that the World Health Organization said virus-carrying droplets might be spreading through airborne particles. So, it is safe to assume that on Feb. 7 “everybody” did not know how the novel coronavirus spread.
